newsitem.title: USA: Telular Corp issues convertible shares.
newsitem.headline: Telular Corp issues convertible shares.

text.p: Telular Corp, a telecommunications technology company, said Friday it has completed its financing by issuing 10,000 shares of Series A convertible preferred stock in exchange for about $10 million under Regulation D provisions of the 1933 Securities Act in a private placement.

The preferred stock reflects the equivalent of a five percent annual stock dividend. The preferred stock automatically converts to Telular common stock on April 16, 1999 or October 16, 1999, depending upon the conversion price, the company said.

"Our current financing is now complete and $20 million has been raised. Telular is now well positioned to fund our planned development of new products" Ken Millard, president and chief executive officer, said in a news release.
Telular shares closed unchanged at four Friday.
